text.name: info1
text.text: The Symbian operating system was the dominant

text.name: info2
text.text: platform for early mobile devices, including

text.name: info3
text.text: smartphones of the era. It was used by brands

text.name: info4
text.text: such as Nokia, Sony Ericsson, Samsung and Motorola.

text.name: info5
text.text: Initially released by Symbian Ltd. in 1997, it was later

text.name: info6
text.text: acquired by Nokia in 2008 as part of their disastrous

text.name: info7
text.text: decision to keep pushing for Symbian for their devices

text.name: info8
text.text: instead of moving on to using Android.
